snippet: Control of the port at Gwadar, near Pakistan’s border with Iran, will pass from a Singaporean company to a company identified as China Overseas Port Holdings.
abstract: Pakistan is handing management control of port at Gwadar, near border with Iran, to Chinese company China Overseas Port Holdings; port has been focus of speculation about China's military and economic ambitions in South Asia for past decade, although analysts note that it is many years from reaching its potential.

byline.contributor: Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Control of the port at Gwadar, near Pakistan’s border with Iran, will pass from a Singaporean company to a company identified as China Overseas Port Holdings.

headline.seo: Chinese Firm Will Run Strategic Pakistani Port at Gwadar
headline.main: Chinese Company Will Run Strategic Pakistani Port
headline.print_headline: Chinese Company Will Run Strategic Pakistani Port
